keyMoments.title: Zoro vs Monet Battle Intensifies
keyMoments.description: Zoro engages in serious combat with Monet, a Logia-type Devil Fruit user, demonstrating his New World combat capabilities.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's growth and willingness to fight seriously against any opponent when protecting others.
keyMoments.quote: I don't make promises to wild animals. They don't know any better.

keyMoments.title: Zoro Uses Ittoryu: Daishinkan
keyMoments.description: Zoro unleashes his most powerful one-sword technique, vertically bisecting Monet with devastating force while strategically choosing not to use Haki.
keyMoments.significance: Debut of one of Zoro's strongest techniques and demonstration of his tactical growth - showing power through restraint rather than just overwhelming force.

keyMoments.title: Strategic Choice to Not Use Haki
keyMoments.description: Zoro deliberately refrains from using Armament Haki when cutting Monet, allowing her to survive while psychologically defeating her.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's maturation as a fighter who understands when to show restraint while still achieving victory.

abilities.description: Zoro's most powerful one-sword style technique where he runs toward his opponent with his sword (Shusui) held outstretched, then executes a powerful two-handed overhead swing capable of cutting opponents in half and creating a shockwave.

reveals.information: Can strategically choose when to use Haki, showing tactical maturity

keyMoments.title: Monet's Yuki Rabi Technique
keyMoments.description: Monet demonstrates her Yuki Rabi (Snow Rabbit) technique, creating fast-moving snow constructs to attack her opponents.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of this named technique from Monet's Yuki Yuki no Mi arsenal.

keyMoments.title: Nearly Breaks Tashigi's Shoulder
keyMoments.description: Monet uses her snow powers to create a devastating attack that nearly shatters Tashigi's shoulder.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the serious offensive threat of Monet's Logia-type abilities.

keyMoments.title: Paralyzed by Fear of Zoro
keyMoments.description: After being cut in half by Zoro's Daishinkan, Monet becomes unable to reform properly due to overwhelming fear, realizing Zoro could have killed her.
keyMoments.significance: Rare instance of a Logia user being defeated psychologically before being physically beaten.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Tashigi
keyMoments.description: Monet is finally defeated by Tashigi's Kiri Shigure technique after her failed counterattack.
keyMoments.significance: Marks Monet's defeat in the Punk Hazard arc.

abilities.description: Monet creates a snow rabbit construct that attacks opponents with incredible speed and force.

reveals.information: Can be psychologically defeated by overwhelming displays of power, even without Haki

keyMoments.title: Battles Monet Alongside Zoro
keyMoments.description: Tashigi fights against Monet in the Biscuit Room, facing a powerful Logia-type opponent.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Tashigi's determination to fight alongside powerful warriors in the New World.

keyMoments.title: Recognizes Zoro's Strategic Restraint
keyMoments.description: Tashigi realizes that Zoro deliberately chose not to use Haki when cutting Monet, understanding his tactical thinking.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Tashigi's growing understanding of high-level combat tactics.
keyMoments.quote: He didn't use Haki... if he had, she would be dead.

keyMoments.title: Uses Kiri Shigure to Defeat Monet
keyMoments.description: Tashigi executes her signature technique Kiri Shigure, a quick-draw slash, to deliver the final blow against Monet.
keyMoments.significance: Debut of Tashigi's named sword technique and her moment to prove herself as a capable swordswoman by defeating a Logia user.

abilities.description: A quick-draw technique where Tashigi cuts and passes her enemy in one swift motion, finishing with her sword held parallel to her back over her head.

reveals.information: Has mastered the Kiri Shigure sword technique
Capable of defeating Logia-type Devil Fruit users

keyMoments.title: Continues Running from Candy-Crazed Children
keyMoments.description: Mocha continues her desperate flight while carrying the candy, trying to protect the other children from the deadly NHC10 drug despite their hostile pursuit.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights Mocha's heroic sacrifice and the tragic consequences of Caesar's experiments.

keyMoments.title: Receives Aid from Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Chopper, Nami, and Robin come to Mocha's aid to help protect the children from themselves.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Straw Hats' commitment to helping Mocha save the children.

reveals.information: Has developed some resistance to NHC10 drug

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Helps Mocha Protect the Children
keyMoments.description: Chopper intervenes to help Mocha and calm the candy-addicted children.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's role as the crew's doctor and his compassion for the suffering children.

keyMoments.title: Helps Mocha Protect the Children
keyMoments.description: Nami aids in protecting the children from the dangerous candy.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nami's protective nature toward children.

keyMoments.title: Helps Mocha Protect the Children
keyMoments.description: Robin assists in calming and protecting the drug-addicted children.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Robin's care for innocent victims.

keyMoments.title: Climbs Out with Momonosuke
keyMoments.description: Luffy struggles to climb out of the garbage chute while carrying the unconscious Momonosuke.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's determination and protective nature.

keyMoments.title: Carried by Luffy While Unconscious
keyMoments.description: Momonosuke remains unconscious in dragon form as Luffy carries him up the garbage chute.
keyMoments.significance: Continues the storyline of Luffy protecting the young samurai.
